alert.note: Alert for Delta (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 7:49PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .Warm temperatures persisting through the overnight hours has accelerated the snowmelt on the Grand Mesa. This has increased flows along Surface Creek and some smaller tributaries with cold runoff. High flows are expected to continue until further notice. ...FLOOD ADVISORY ALONG SURFACE CREEK FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...Along Surface Creek to the confluence with the Gunnison River. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 PM MDT, Gauge reports indicated high river flows due to accelerated snowmelt off the Grand Mesa. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Surface Creek - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orchard City, Cedaredge and Eckert. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
